meanings.definition: To scrape or dig with the nails or claws.
meanings.sent1: The cat was scratching the tree to sharpen its claws.
meanings.sent2: I saw a man scratching his head in confusion.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel was scratching at the door, trying to find a way in.
meanings.sent4: The old record player needle was scratching the vinyl, creating a unique sound.
meanings.sent5: The gardener was scratching the soil to plant new seeds.

meanings.definition: A mark or injury made by scraping with the nails or claws.
meanings.sent1: The kitten had a scratching on its ear from a playful fight.
meanings.sent2: The scratching on the furniture was a result of the cat's behavior.
meanings.sent3: She noticed a scratching on the car door, probably from a stray cat.
meanings.sent4: The scratching on the wooden floor revealed the dog's playful nature.
meanings.sent5: The scratching on the wall indicated the presence of rodents.

meanings.definition: A sound made by scraping or rubbing a surface with the nails or claws.
meanings.sent1: The scratching of the chalk on the blackboard was unbearable.
meanings.sent2: I heard a scratching coming from the attic, probably a mouse.
meanings.sent3: The scratching of the branches against the window made her jump.
meanings.sent4: The scratching of the pen on paper filled the room with a rhythmic sound.
meanings.sent5: The scratching of the cat on the scratching post was a familiar sound in the house.
